channel.title: Welcome to Site Bay support on Site Bay Tutorials
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to Site Bay support on Site Bay Tutorials

item.title: Get Started with Site Bay
item.description: Set Sail with Site Bay!Let’s get started with Site Bay, Powerful WordPress Hosting! This tutorial will help you sign up for an account on My Site Bay, our browser-based control panel where you can create, manage, and monitor your WordPress sites.

item.title: API v1.000.0
item.description: Added

item.title: Recovering from a WordPress Hack
item.description: If your WordPress site has been hacked, one of the best ways to recover from the hack is to use My Site Bay’s Point-in-Time Machine (PIT Machine).

item.title: Site Bay Recordings
item.description: The Site Bay recordings Page thanks to PostHog, My Site Bay provides real-time recordings of how user’s use your Site Bay hosted WordPress site.

item.title: Subscribe to Site Bay Status Updates
item.description: The Site Bay Status Page provides real-time system status and maintenance updates via email, SMS, and Atom and RSS feed.

item.title: What’s New
item.description: Here is a list of new and updated tutorials. Please check back often and be sure to tell a friend!

item.title: Set up a Subdomain or Path for your WordPress Site
item.description: If you want to create a separate, dedicated section of your WordPress site for a specific purpose, such as a blog or an online store, a subdomain can be a great solution.

item.title: Fix DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN in Chrome
item.description: What does DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN mean?NXDOMAIN just means that is domain does not exist. If your domain is unable to resolve via DNS, this error returns.

item.title: Accounts and Passwords
item.description: Email Addresses and Contact InformationSite Bay uses the contact information on file in your account to notify and bill you.

item.title: Getting Started with the Site Bay API
item.description: The Site Bay API is a powerful tool that allows you to access and use all of Site Bay’s features and functionality through a simple, easy-to-use interface.

item.title: Developers
item.description: Site Bay APISite Bay’s API allows you to do the following: List Snapshots View Snapshot

item.title: Get Started
item.description: Use Site Bay’s Point-in-time MachineYou can restore your site, create a new staging site, or view files from a previous time on My Site Bay.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Blog Posts How to Keep WordPress Secure: The Basics

item.title: A Beginner's Tutorial to WordPress
item.description: WordPress, often referred to as WP is a free and open source content management system (CMS) written in PHP and paired with a database (MariaDB), used by more than 40.

item.title: A Beginner's Tutorial to WordPress Part 2
item.description: Advanced WordPress TutorialIn this tutorial, we will cover some advanced features and techniques that you can use to customize and optimize your WordPress site.

item.title: How to Use Site Bay's Templates
item.description: Templates help you easily create a ready-made site from a list of various pre-designed themes and pages with demo images and text from My Site Bay, without the hassle of creating a site from scratch.

item.title: Billing Manager
item.description: Site Bay WordPress HostingFull details of our plan are on our pricing page Going over your plan’s visits limit can result in a Visits overage charge.

item.title: Best IDE Software for WordPress Development
Best IDE Software for WordPress Development
How to Get Started with our Photography Portfolio Template
item.description: Are you a photographer looking to start your own blog to showcase your work? With Site Bay’s easy-to-use template, you can get your photography blog up and running in just minutes.

item.title: Site Bay Support
item.description: Site Bay provides live support services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Site Bay Support ensures your site’s availability and strives to fix any issues you may be experiencing.

item.title: How to Secure Your WordPress
item.description: In the Getting Started tutorial, you learned how to create a site and do basic tasks.

item.title: Tax Information
item.description: Which Taxes are Collected by Site Bay?Site Bay does not collect tax as of yet.

item.title: How Billing Works
item.description: We strive to create simple and clear billing policy. If you have a question specific to your account, please feel free to contact Support in My Site Bay.

item.title: Site Bay Writer's Formatting Tutorial
item.description: Write Tutorials for Site BayThis tutorial provides templates and tutoriallines to use when creating or updating a tutorial for Site Bay Support.

item.title: WordPress Logging and Monitoring
item.description: Site Bay offers recordings and analytics, so you can track and monitor your site’s performance. This allows you to identify any issues and make improvements, ensuring that your site is always running at its best.
